title: No, Benjamin Franklin didn't say, "We're all born ignorant, but one has to work hard to stay stupid."
text: Another Mimi trying to put words in the mouths of historical figures is doing tours on Facebook. This time, it's Benjamin Franklin in the light. The site of June 23, which received more than 6,800 shares in just a few days, uses President Trump as a target to quote the alleged Franklin. We share the "Occupant Democrats" page on Facebook, the article shows a picture of Franklin with the following quote: "We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid." Underneath that, a picture of President Trump appears along with the words "the hardest working man in America." The article was referred to as part of Facebook efforts to combat false news and misleading information in its news broadcast. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) On January 10, 2021, in an article on Facebook, he said that Nancy Belusi had sent a letter to the Mayor of Portland after demonstrations there "to demand that he stick to the proven democratic playbook." Carla Mulford, an English professor at the University of Pennsylvania and author of the book Benjamin Franklin and the End of Empire, referred to Franklin's papers, a comprehensive database of Franklin's writings, to verify the quotation. She added, "This is some modern expression attributed to Franklin. The man was more eloquent and wealthy." However, research into Franklin's volumes of works collected on the database did not produce results for any part of the quotation. Also, a list of famous quotations from the inventor on the website of the Franklin Institute, a scientific museum containing the Benjamin Franklin National Memorial, did not include the quotation. The mathematician Barry Bobick also studied the quote in 2013 and found no evidence that Franklin said or wrote. Bobk reported that the phrase "has been cited in printing only since about 1999" - far from Franklin's life. This "quote" is pants on fire!
